section.name: Configuration
section.p: When using the Jerk, you provide a configuration directory on the command line. The jerk will read several files from this directory to configure itself.

section.name: servers.conf
section.p: Within the configuration directory should be a file called servers.conf which specifies to address and port of server to connect to when launched.

section.name: services.conf
section.p: Within the configuration directory should be a file called services.conf which specifies configuration parameters for services.
section.source:
# Define the 'log' service log : com.werken.jerk.services.log.LogService
# service-wide config props service.log.dir : ./logs/
# default per-channel config props channel.log.txt : on channel.log.html : on

section.name: commands.conf
section.p: Within the configuration directory should be a file called commands.conf. It is a java properties file where each property line has the name of the command as the name, and the name of the command's class as the value.
section.source:
join : com.werken.jerk.commands.core.Join part : com.werken.jerk.commands.core.Part
start : com.werken.jerk.commands.core.Start stop : com.werken.jerk.commands.core.Stop
help : com.werken.jerk.commands.core.Help say : com.werken.jerk.commands.say.Say
